summary: "The Count of Monte Cristo" is an exciting adventure novel by French author Alexandre Dumas, written in 1844. The story follows Edmond Dantès, a young French sailor falsely accused of treason and imprisoned. A fellow prisoner, Abbé Faria, helps him escape and leads him to hidden treasure. With this wealth, Dantès becomes the mysterious Count of Monte Cristo and seeks revenge against those who wronged him. Set in France, Italy, and the Mediterranean from 1815 to 1839, the book explores themes of hope, justice, and forgiveness. It's one of Dumas' most popular works and a classic in literature.
title: The Count of Monte Cristo
